lead_paragraph: After Hurricane Matthew dropped torrential rain, the worst damage occurred inland, in places that might typically be havens.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Cerro Gordo; Lizette Alvarez from St. Augustine, Fla.; and Campbell Robertson from Charleston, S.C. Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Tampa, Fla., and Frances Robles from Jacksonville, Fla.
byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD, LIZETTE ALVAREZ and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON

headline.print_headline: Inland Havens Watched in Shock as Waters Rose
headline.main: Fleeing the Coast Before the Storm, Only to Be Trapped Inland

snippet: After Hurricane Matthew dropped torrential rain, the worst damage occurred inland, in places that might typically be havens....
abstract: Residents in inland areas of North Carolina describe experience of watching floodwaters rapidly rise as Hurricane Matthew tears path of destruction; 11 people have perished so far in floodwaters, and more than two dozen people had to be rescued by helicopter, in North Carolina alone; authorities fear state's swollen rivers will continue to rise for days, bringing more heavy flooding.
